Name: Kohl pot in the shape of a palm column
Description: Underneath the palm-leaf capital are four circular ribs, above the outwardly flaring palm leaves is a rectangular architrave with a pierced extension for affixing the swivel lid (missing). Opposite this hole, between two leaves, is a round depression for securing the lid with the cosmetic pencil. The hollowing out is deep and cylindrical. The exterior has a black glaze with a blue stripe near the bottom.
